V201234.title: PRE: GOVERNMENT RUN BY A FEW BIG INTERESTS OR FOR BENEFIT OF ALL
V201234.question: Would you say the government is pretty much run by a few big interests looking out for themselves or that it is run for the benefit of all the people?
V201234.answer: govt run for benefit of all people,

V201235.title: PRE: DOES GOVERNMENT WASTE MUCH TAX MONEY
V201235.question: Do you think that people in government waste a lot of the money we pay in taxes, waste some of it, or don’t waste very much of it?
V201235.answer: govt doesn't waste much tax money,

V201236.title: PRE: HOW MANY IN GOVERNMENT ARE CORRUPT
V201236.question: How many of the people running the government are corrupt?

V201237.title: PRE: HOW OFTEN CAN PEOPLE BE TRUSTED
V201237.question: Generally speaking, how often can you trust other people?

V201238.title: PRE: ELECTIONS MAKE GOVERNMENT PAY ATTENTION
V201238.question: How much do you feel that having elections makes the government pay attention to what the people think?
V201238.answer: elections don't make govt pay attention,

V201246.title: PRE: 7PT SCALE SPENDING & SERVICES: SELFPLACEMENT
V201246.question: Some people think the government should provide fewer services even in areas such as health and education in order to reduce spending. Suppose these people are at one end of a scale, at point 1. Other people feel it is important for the government to provide many more services even if it means an increase in spending. Suppose these people are at the other end, at point 7. Where would you place yourself on this scale, or haven’t you thought much about this?

V201249.title: PRE: 7PT SCALE DEFENSE SPENDING: SELF-PLACEMENT
V201249.question: Some people believe that we should spend much less money for defense. Suppose these people are at one end of a scale, at point 1. Others feel that defense spending should be greatly increased. Suppose these people are at the other end, at point 7. Where would you place yourself on this scale, or haven’t you thought much about this?

V201252.title: PRE: 7PT SCALE GOV-PRIVATE MEDICAL INSURANCE SCALE: SELF-PLACEMENT
V201252.question: There is much concern about the rapid rise in medical and hospital costs. Some people feel there should be a government insurance plan which would cover all medical and hospital expenses for everyone. Suppose these people are at one end of a scale, at point 1. Others feel that all medical expenses should be paid by individuals through private insurance plans like Blue Cross or other company paid plans. Suppose these people are at the other end, at point 7.

V201255.title: PRE: 7PT SCALE GUARANTEED JOB-INCOME SCALE: SELF-PLACEMENT
V201255.question: Some people feel the government in Washington should see to it that every person has a job and a good standard of living. Suppose these people are at one end of a scale, at point 1. Others think the government should just let each person get ahead on their own. Suppose these people are at the other end, at point 7.
V201255.answer: govt shouldn't provide guaranteed jobs & ubi,

V201258.title: PRE: 7PT SCALE GOV ASSISTANCE TO BLACKS SCALE: SELF-PLACEMENT
V201258.question: Some people feel that the government in Washington should make every effort to improve the social and economic position of blacks. Suppose these people are at one end of a scale, at point 1. Others feel that the government should not make any special effort to help blacks because they should help themselves. Suppose these people are at the other end, at point 7.

V201262.title: PRE: 7PT SCALE ENVIRONMENT-BUSINESS TRADEOFF: SELF-PLACEMENT
V201262.question: Some people think we need much tougher government regulations on business in order to protect the environment. Suppose these people are at one end of a scale, at point 1. Others think that current regulations to protect the environment are already too much of a burden on business. Suppose these people are at the other end, at point 7.

V201323x.title: PRE: SUMMARY: FEDERAL BUDGET SPENDING: PROTECTING THE ENVIRONMENT
V201323x.question: Should federal spending on protecting the environment be increased, decreased, or kept the same?

V201336.title: RE: STD ABORTION: SELF-PLACEMENT
V201336.question: 1. By law, abortion should never be permitted 2. The law should permit abortion only in case of rape, incest, or when the woman’s life is in danger 3. By law, a woman should always be able to obtain an abortion as a matter of personal choice

V201362x.title: PRE: SUMMARY: FAVOR/OPPOSE ALLOWING FELONS TO VOTE

V201366.title: PRE: HOW IMPORTANT THAT NEWS ORGANIZATIONS FREE TO CRITICIZE

V201366.answer: important that news can criticize politicians,

V201367.question: How important is it that the executive, legislative, and judicial branches of government keep one another from having too much power?

V201368.question: How important is it that elected officials face serious consequences if they engage in misconduct?
V201368.answer: important elected officials face consequences for misconduct,

V201369.title: PRE: HOW IMPORTANT THAT PEOPLE AGREE ON BASIC FACTS
V201369.question: How important is it that people agree on basic facts even if they disagree politically?
V201369.answer: important people agree on basic facts,

V201372x.title: PRE: SUMMARY: HELPFUL/HARMFUL IF PRES DIDN’T HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT CONGRESS/COURTS
V201372x.question: Would it be helpful, harmful, or neither helpful nor harmful if U.S. presidents could work on the country’s problems without paying attention to what Congress and the courts say?
V201372x.answer: bad if us president could bypass courts/congress,

V201375x.title: PRE: SUMMARY: FAVOR OR OPPOSE RESTRICTING JOURNALIST ACCESS
V201375x.question: Do you favor, oppose, or neither favor nor oppose elected officials restricting journalists’ access to information about government decision-making?
V201375x.answer: do not restrict journalist access to govt info,

V201376.answer: concerned govt want to undermine media,

V201377.title: PRE: HOW MUCH TRUST IN NEWS MEDIA
V201377.question: In general, how much trust and confidence do you have in the news media when it comes to reporting the news fully, accurately, and fairly?

V201378.title: PRE: APPROPRIATE/INAPPROPRIATE PRES ASK FOREIGN COUNTRIES TO INVESTIGATE RIVALS
V201378.question: In general, how appropriate or inappropriate is it for the president of the United States to ask leaders of foreign countries to investigate political rivals?
V201378.answer: pres shouldnt ask foreign countries to investigate rivals,

V201379.title: PRE: PREFER GOVERNMENT OFFICIAL WHO COMPROMISES OR STICKS TO PRINCIPLES
V201379.question: Would you prefer a government official who compromises to get things done, or who sticks to their principles no matter what?
V201379.answer: stick to principles and not compromise,

V201386x.title: PRE: SUMMARY: FAVOR OR OPPOSE HOUSE IMPEACHMENT DECISION
V201386x.question: Do you favor, oppose, or neither favor nor oppose the U.S. House of Representatives’ decision in December of last year to impeach President Trump?

V201389x.question: Do you favor, oppose, or neither favor nor oppose the U.S. Senate’s decision in February to acquit President Trump of the impeachment charges and thus let him remain in office?

V201392x.question: Do you think the federal government’s response to the COVID-19 outbreak earlier this year was too quick, too slow, or aboutright?

V201405x.title: PRE: SUMMARY: REQUIRE EMPLOYERS TO OFFER PAID LEAVE TO PARENTS OF NEW CHILDREN
V201405x.question: Do you favor, oppose, or neither favor nor oppose requiring employers to offer paid leave to parents of new children?

V201408x.title: PRE: SUMMARY: SERVICES TO SAME SEX COUPLES

V201408x.answer: business should provide services to same sex couples,

V201416.question: Should gay people be allowed to get married?

V202412.title: POST: CSES5-Q04D: ATTITUDES ABOUT ELITES: POLITICIANS ARE MAIN PROBLEM IN US
V202412.question: Do you agree with the following statement: 'Politicians are the main problem in the United States.'
V202412.answer: politicians not main problem in US

V202413.title: POST: CSES5-Q04E: ATTITUDES ABOUT ELITES: STRONG LEADER IN GOVERNMENT IS GOOD
V202413.question: Do you agree with the following statement: 'Having a strong leader in government is good for the United States even if the leader bends the rules to get things done.'
V202413.answer: strong leader that bends rule bad for US

V202414.title: POST: CSES5-Q04F: ATTITUDES ABOUT ELITES: PEOPLE SHOULD MAKE POLICY DECISIONS
V202414.question: Do you agree with the following statement: 'The people, and not politicians, should make our most important policy decisions.'
V202414.answer: politicans should make policy instead of people

V202415.title: POST: CSES5-Q04G: ATTITUDES ABOUT ELITES: POLITICIANS ONLY CARE ABOUT THE RICH
V202415.question: Do you agree with the following statement: 'Most politicians care only about the interests of the rich and powerful.'
V202415.answer: politicians don't only care about rich/powerful

V202416.title: POST: CSES5-Q05A: OUT-GROUP ATTITUDES: MINORITIES SHOULD ADAPT
V202416.question: Do you agree with the following statement: 'Minorities should adapt to the customs and traditions of the United States.'
V202416.answer: minorities shouldn't adapt to customs of US

V202417.title: POST: CSES5-Q05B: OUT-GROUP ATTITUDES: WILL OF MAJORITY SHOULD ALWAYS PREVAIL
V202417.question: Do you agree with the following statement: 'The will of the majority should always prevail, even over the rights of minorities.'
V202417.answer: will of majority shouldn't prevail over minority rights'
